text:
Hi everyone,

I am not sure, but may be <@U02227D27V3> could help me?

I am currently taking the course "HubSpot CMS for Developers" and I have a question according to the requirements for the Practicum, exactly according to this part:

â€¢ _All work must be your own. During the grading process we will check the revision history. Submissions that do not meet this requirement will not be considered._
*So, the question is:* what should I do to make sure my practicum project will be accepted? Should it be typed letter by letter? Or is it acceptable to use some HubL code snippets and JSON copied from the Design Manager (that are generated there when we create a module in the Design manager)?

Thanks a lot in advance.

Hi Julia,

You can use those code snippets, but not like exact copy paste, you have to follow the standard process of doing the practice like you are doing on your own.

Thanks a lot Umakant,
I greatly appreciate your help. :+1:

Also, could you please let me know: do I have to run
`hs watch`   command (instead of using `hs upload`) to ensure my project will be accepted for assessment? Thank you!

the difference between `hs watch` and `hs upload` is that watch uploads from your local to HubSpot account on every save and upload handles that when you run command.

so the whole idea behind those are that reviewer can see your step by step approach and how you build the app progressively rather then doing it all at once and uploading when fully ready.

now, to use it - you have to simply run the command as you use upload and keep the console /terminal open when you are doing the dev work, it will upload on changes in real time and you can see the changes on your HubSpot url.
Great, thanks a lot for your explanation! :raised_hands:

Hi all. When I try to create a page according to the "Creating a Template in HubSpot CMS" video, I am not seeing the same options. I uploaded my template and I can see it in the design tools, but when I try to create a new page, I do not see my template anywhere. I can only see this page. Any advice to get me back on track?
